output.conclusion: Upon completion of this course, participants will possess expert-level knowledge of building materials, enabling them to make informed decisions in design, construction, and material selection for sustainable and durable structures.
output.courseTitle: Building Materials: Advanced Concepts and Applications
output.introduction: This course provides an in-depth exploration of building materials, focusing on advanced concepts, performance characteristics, and sustainable applications. Designed for experts in the field, it covers a wide range of materials, from traditional to innovative, emphasizing their properties, behavior, and impact on building design and construction.

chapters.description: Explore high-performance concrete (HPC), self-consolidating concrete (SCC), fiber-reinforced concrete (FRC), and their applications in complex structures. Discuss mix design, durability, and long-term performance.

Examine alternative cementitious materials like geopolymers, calcium sulfoaluminate (CSA) cements, and magnesium oxide (MgO) cements. Analyze their properties, production methods, and environmental impact.
Investigate the properties and applications of high-strength steel alloys in structural engineering. Cover topics such as fatigue resistance, corrosion protection, and welding techniques.

Analyze the use of fiber-reinforced polymers (FRP) and other composite materials in structural reinforcement and new construction. Discuss design considerations, installation methods, and long-term durability.

Explore the use of engineered wood products (EWP) such as cross-laminated timber (CLT) and glued laminated timber (glulam) in sustainable building design. Cover topics such as fire resistance, seismic performance, and life-cycle assessment.
Examine the properties, processing, and applications of bamboo as a sustainable building material. Discuss its structural capabilities, durability, and potential for use in low-cost housing.

Investigate advanced insulation materials such as aerogels, vacuum insulation panels (VIPs), and phase-change materials (PCMs). Discuss their thermal performance, cost-effectiveness, and environmental impact.

Explore the concept of smart building envelopes that respond to changing environmental conditions. Cover topics such as dynamic glazing, responsive shading systems, and integrated photovoltaic (PV) systems.
Analyze the mechanisms of material degradation and corrosion in building structures. Discuss advanced corrosion protection techniques, including coatings, cathodic protection, and material selection.
Explore advanced NDT methods for assessing the condition of building materials and structures. Cover techniques such as ultrasonic testing, ground-penetrating radar (GPR), and infrared thermography.

chapters.chapterTitle: Life Cycle Assessment (LCA) of Building Materials
chapters.description: Apply LCA methodology to evaluate the environmental impact of building materials throughout their life cycle. Discuss data collection, impact assessment, and interpretation of results.
Develop strategies for selecting building materials that minimize environmental impact and promote sustainability. Cover topics such as embodied energy, carbon footprint, and recyclability.
